title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. A, ch. II, pt. 218 - Uniform Rules For The Trial Courts In Capital Cases
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. A, ch. II, pt. 218 - Uniform Rules For The Trial Courts In Capital Cases

State Regulations
§ 218.0 - Repealed
§ 218.1 - Record transcription and reproduction; settlement
§ 218.2 - Capital sentencing determination and findings form
§ 218.3 - Notice to the capital defender office
§ 218.4 - Stays of execution: automatic or determined by superior court
§ 218.5 - Case history
§ 218.6 - Remittitur
§ 218.7 - Capital case data reports
§ 218.10 - Repealed
§ 218.20 to 218.22 - Repealed
§ 218.30 to 218.32 - Repealed

Preamble: Preamble:Acting pursuant to the rulemaking
authority invested in this Court by New York Constitution, article VI, §
30 and Laws of 1995, chapter 1, the Court of Appeals establishes these Uniform

Rules for the Trial Courts in Capital Cases. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. A, ch. II, pt. 218

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
